channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024110371
item.description:
Report E-2024110371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: CREST HILL
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) ounces released into the shrink-wrap from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum containing DT STYPOL 040-4332. Personnel advised the drum sustained a dent in the back due to damage from the trailer wall, which caused a small hole and was the cause of the release. Dayton Freight advised they no surfaces were impacted since release was contained to shrink-wrap. The terminal personnel stated they overpacked the drum and the shrink wrap and generated one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART WAS CALLED TO BAY 266 FOR LEAKER. BOX FOUND ON ITS SIDE WITH CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL AND SULFURIC ACID LABEL STILL IN TACT. WENT THROUGH THE DISCISION TREE TO THE CORROSIVE HAZARD RESPONSE. NEUTRALIZED SPILL AND BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024110334
item.description:
Report E-2024110334

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup release of product from one (1) five (5) gallon metal pail, impacting the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel advised they cleaned up the release using Oil Dri absorbent and generated one (1) fifteen (15) gallon poly drum containing spent absorbent and released product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110378
item.description:
Report E-2024110378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: GALVA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver was trying to clear the scrubber on the vac trailer about 1/2 gallon blew out onto the pavement at 1630ct. The driver did have a container under the valve to contain any material when trying to clean it out but there was blockage in the line causing excessive pressure and it then sprayed out of the container. Absorbent were put down and the material was cleaned up within about 15 minutes and the absorbent were disposed of properly.

item.description:
Report X-2024110453

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-19T12:23:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: JOLIET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Load consisted of insufficient blocking and bracing. Ty-Gard was not pressed into corrugation of container and is only sufficient enough to hold 8,800 lbs. of lading. In addition, several drums were floor loaded, and others loaded onto pallets causing the load to shift and damage 1 drum.

item.title: Report X-2024110559
item.description:
Report X-2024110559

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE X TWO OUNCE FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF K W KNOCK'ER LOOSE PENETRANT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 9X9R20, FLEETPRIDE, 2770 ALFT CT, ELGIN IL 60124-8186.

item.title: Report E-2024110320
item.description:
Report E-2024110320

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 8, 2024, six (6) 25-pound bags of UN1477 were damaged and released approximately two (2) pounds of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools to remediate the site, and all impacted drums and materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110261
item.description:
Report E-2024110261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 6, 2024, eleven (11) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were collected in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110223
item.description:
Report E-2024110223

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-24
  • City: Rockford
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifty (50) pounds of Azodicarbonamide released from one (1) fifty (50) pound plastic bag. The release was due to a loading error by a previous terminal, which caused the box to tear and damaged the bag inside of it. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the spill and generated one (1) twenty (20) gallon poly drum of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
